postJob: Advisory - Performance Improvement – Data and Analytics Staff Intern - Toronto
descrip: EY’s people in more than 150 countries are committed to operating with integrity, quality, and professionalism in the provision of audit, tax, transaction, and advisory services. We strive to help all of our people achieve their professional and personal goals through an inclusive environment that values everyone's contributions, appreciates diversity of thought, fosters growth, and provides continuous opportunities for development. Recognized as one of Canada's top employers, EY continually strives to be a great place to work.  Being part of a dynamic, growing organization offers an exciting career path full of opportunity. EY Advisory Services is a $4 billion global practice with 18,000 professionals. With an overall Advisory market of $150 billion, there's tremendous potential for growth - and we're prepared to tap into that potential. Our Advisory team takes a strategic approach to helping clients improve and sustain their business performance. In today's complex business environment that means understanding the relationship between risk and performance improvement and applying our knowledge to help clients achieve their business objectives.  At EY we are committed to building a better working world and provide ongoing professional development through diverse experiences, world-class learning, and individually tailored coaching. As a part of that, we develop our people and equip them with the skills to be successful, versatile business leaders. Within the Advisory service line we align our new consultants to a sub-service line (e.g. Strategy & Operations, IT Advisory) based on background, preference, and need. While consulting professionals belong to a sub-service line, our teams work closely together to solve client problems. As a new consultant, it is common to work on engagements that span our sub-service lines or industry teams, allowing for both depth and breadth of experience.  We are currently seeking Staff and Senior Consultants to join our Data and Analytics Practice.  Data and Analytics is the result of effectively and efficiently leveraging a set of technology enabled management and analytic processes and techniques including Data Science that help businesses to operationalize strategic goals. Core processes include risk, marketing, customer, finance and performance analytics, information strategy and management, financial planning, operational planning, consolidation and reporting, business modeling, and monitoring of key performance indicators linked to strategy. Our driver-based decision-making process, which links strategy, targets and operations, reduces administrative costs, improves strategic decision-making and accelerates decision-making cycle time, is a business led market differentiator which helps clients see their business differently. Advisory Services offers variety, challenge, responsibility and the opportunity to realize your leadership potential. Responsibilities Participate in project teams through all phases of the information, data, and data science life cycle. Lend specific subject matter Data Science and Information Management knowledge to the design and integration phase of each project, helping to give specificity to the appropriate information architecture, data model, predictive analytics model, and system design and interfacing requirements, and IM technology platforms.  Advise clients on a variety of Information Management services and Data products that help identify, assess, manage, optimize, and measure the organization's capabilities. Team with client information, data, and technology professionals, and/or third-party strategic alliances to provide implementation of solutions. Participate in engagement management, engagement execution and reporting, and client relationship building and management. This will include the generation of new business opportunities by developing ideas and solutions to present to internal and external clients. The position will be responsible for delivering against business development targets and managing a portfolio of potential and existing client engagements. LOCATION: Fort Myers, Florida | Toronto, Canada OVERVIEW FieldEdge (www.fieldedge.com), is the leading provider of field service management solutions to the mechanical contractor market. FieldEdge helps thousands of service-based organizations increase sales performance and overall workforce productivity by managing all aspects of their daily operations. You can think of FieldEdge as a hyper-growth software company with a startup culture that is backed by 35 years of industry-leading knowledge. JOB DESCRIPTION The Senior Data Analyst will help new clients convert their data onto the FieldEdge platform. Company Profile: Fusion Pharmaceuticals is a newly formed biopharmaceutical company discovering and developing targeted alpha-particle radiotherapeutics for treating cancer. Targeted alpha-particle emitting radiotherapeutics combine the precision of molecular targeting agents, such as antibodies, with the potency of alpha-particle emitting radioisotopes to specifically attack and eradicate cancer cells. Overview: As a member of the Chemistry/Radiochemistry Department you will be responsible for working in accordance with company policy while contributing your expertise to support current projects and develop future drugs/therapeutics within the Fusion portfolio. You will also be responsible for developing and delivering synthetic strategies leading to novel chemical matter. The right candidate will embrace maintaining a laboratory presence while offering mentorship to other members of the team.  Reporting to the Director of Chemistry, Scientific Duties include but are not limited to: Provide leadership in the research and development in the synthesis novel linker scaffolds to chemically modify proteins/antibodies  Develop and conduct multistep chemical synthesis and interpret analytical data to elucidate the structure of small molecules  Contribute to the scientific direction of the company, setting goals and priorities consistent with the organizational needs  Prepare and deliver scientific findings through presentations both internally and externally  Establish and oversee projects with minimal guidance  Oversee laboratory staff as assigned  All other duties as assigned Experience and Responsibilities: PhD with at least 5 years of direct scientist experience with significant accomplishments  Comprehensive understanding of medicinal chemistry and structure-activity relationships (SAR)  Knowledge of organometallic and/or radiochemistry with a broad-based knowledge of protein conjugate scientific literature is highly desirable  Strong synthetic skills in organic/inorganic chemistry  Knowledge of compound design strategies and lead optimization approaches  Ability to be a spokesperson for chemistry across the organization  Desire for working in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment  The ability to coach and delegate effectively while functioning as an integral part of the team  To complete the application please visit: https://fusionpharma.prevueaps.com/jobs/  If you require accommodation for your application or interview, please contact Human Resources directly at 905.525.9140 ext. 21112 or by email at careers@imagingprobes.ca  We thank all those who apply but only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

Cyber Security ScientistApply NowINTRO Canadian Nuclear Laboratories (CNL) is Canada's premier nuclear science and technology organization. CNL has been a world leader in developing peaceful and innovative applications from nuclear technology through its expertise in physics, metallurgy, chemistry, biology and engineering. CNL's 3500 highly skilled employees deliver a range of nuclear services – from research and development, design and engineering to specialized technology, waste management and decommissioning.  CNL's cyber security research team conducts leading edge research in cyber security of instrumentation and control systems in the nuclear industry. Digital security concerns and evolving standards and regulations are driving demand for safe and secure solutions by both business and industrial consumers. Unlike IT systems, industrial control systems are often bound by strict regulatory requirements and rigorous change controls that introduce complexities, risks and costs that are substantially higher for any modernization or modification and therefore requires specialists in I&C systems with cyber security expertise.  CNL is looking for a Cyber Security Research Scientist/Engineer who has a keen interest in cyber security and demonstrated aptitude for computer technology, software development and/or instrumentation and control application development. DUTIESServe as a member of the cyber security research group, performing activities that range from conducting literature surveys to using technology to assess the suitability of various cyber security tools in industrial control system applications. Research areas may address cyber asset identification and classification, vulnerability assessments, intrusion detection, penetration testing, countermeasures development and assessment, automated auditing, data analytics, and forensic analysis.Support the installation, configuration and maintenance of a cyber test facility. Duties may include, for example, the installation and configuration of virtual servers, next generation firewalls, intrusion detection appliances, and process control simulation equipment.Perform software development activities such as extending open-source software to add new features and functionality in support of cyber security projectsPrepare research reports in clear and compelling writingCollaborate with other researchers and stakeholders.Promote a strong security cultureQUALIFICATIONSCandidate must possess an undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Applied Mathematics from a university of recognized standing.Introductory knowledge and/or experience with one or more cyber security technologies (e.g., intrusion detection systems, forensic analysis tools, next generation firewalls, application control, whitelisting, AV, encryption, automated auditing, analytics)Software development experience with at least one programming/scripting language (e.g., C, C++, C#, Java, Python, Perl).General knowledge and/or experience in aspects of the software development lifecycle and associated tools (e.g., requirements, design, implementation, integration, test, deployment, revision control, configuration management, change control).Experience in the following technologies is highly desirable:Modern computing technologies (e.g., VMWare and Hyper-V HyperVisors, switch and firewall configurations, Web Servers)Operating systems (e.g., Windows, Windows Server, Linux)Communication protocols (e.g., TCP/IP, HTTP, SSL)I&C systems (e.g., PLCs, DCS)Industrial I&C communication protocols (MODBUS, Profibus, OPC)Initiative and ability to work effectively with others in a team environment, and have the ability to independently identify and solve technical problems. CNL has an Employment Equity Program and encourages applications from women, Aboriginal Peoples, visible minorities and persons with disabilities.
